document_name: Civil Works for Community Security and Arms Control Project

outputs.output_descr:
This project is an integral part of the United Nations' support to the Government of South Sudan's efforts to build confidence, stability and security for communities in South Sudan, thereby providing an enabling environment for post-war development and reconciliation.   The project will work through key GSS institutions - the Bureau for Community Security & Small Arms Control (BCSSAC) and the South Sudan Peace & Reconciliation Commission (SSPRC)  to ensure government ownership and sustainability of the project.  The project will help both institutions to continue to coordinate at all levels of government in order to carry out peaceful disarmament through a comprehensive approach by addressing the root causes of armed violence, promote conflict-sensitive development and peace building measures.  A robust public information and community sensitization/awareness campaign will underscore all activities in order to alter existing mindsets and support peaceful conflict resolution and broader reconciliation.  The project will contribute to achievement  of the following results:  
•	Provide technical support to the BCCSSAC on policy and legislation on small arms / light weapons control, ensuring the gender dimensions are fully incorporated
•	Public Information & Community Sensitization on SALW control and community security, guided by national legislation and policies
•	Conduct consultations at the sub-county level to prioritize localized level conflict prevention initiatives and support the implementation of catalytic micro-development projects in Eastern Equatoria, Jonglei, Upper Nile and Warrap
•	Support to SSPRC State offices to develop and implement State Conflict Transformation Strategies (CTS) in 6 states

The project will work through key GSS institutions - the Bureau for Community Security & Small Arms Control (BCSSAC) and the South Sudan Peace & Reconciliation Commission (SSPRC)  to ensure government ownership and sustainability of the project.  The project will help both institutions to continue to coordinate at all levels of government in order to carry out peaceful disarmament through a comprehensive approach by addressing the root causes of armed violence, promote conflict-sensitive development and peace building measures.  A robust public information and community sensitization/awareness campaign will underscore all activities in order to alter existing mindsets and support peaceful conflict resolution and broader reconciliation.  The project will contribute to achievement  of the following results:

•	Public Information & Community Sensitization on SALW control and community security, guided by national legislation and policies

•	Support to SSPRC State offices to develop and implement State Conflict Transformation Strategies (CTS) in 6 states
Community Security & Small Arms Control (CSAC) support to improved security environment allows for development at the community level with specific attention to women's security needs in South Sudan.

donor_name: DEPT OF FOR AFF & INTL TRADE GOV CANADA
